website_summaries.verdict: Nice photo quality, improved autofocus performance, and a very compact design make the Canon PowerShot S110 a solid option if you're looking for something between a point-and-shoot and an enthusiast compact. But if you can find them cheaper, the S100 or S95 are still good alternatives.
pros: The Canon PowerShot S110 has better autofocus than its predecessor while maintaining good-to-excellent photo quality
cons: A not-very-impressive implementation of the new wireless connectivity features and still-sluggish image processing weigh down the camera

customer_reviews.title: Don't spend a lot more time doing online comparisons. This is the camera to have, great gift, great price.
customer_reviews.text: Love this camera! Incredibly durable, takes amazing shots; if you play with the settings, this little powerhouse can mimic a full scale digital SLR! The only downside is the occasional "Lens Errror" which is a Canon thing and can strike light lightning (very rare). It means you need to send the camera back, but Canon and Amazon are incredibly efficient about it and you'll have it back in 5-7 days, good as new. Go for it, the price is right and you really can't beat this camera.
customer_reviews.author: wolfeman

customer_reviews.title: A Disappointing Waste of $500
customer_reviews.text: Right off the top: CONS - the automatic lens cover jammed and refuses to completely open. Does Canon have Quality Control inspectors? - no detent for the function ring on top. Pull the camera from your pocket in low light conditions? Count on the ring turning to a setting guaranteed to ruin your shot - Menu difficult to navigate. Too many arcane and unnecessary menu options - Slow autofocus - Dubious quality control PROS - Small size is convenient - Takes acceptable images, after getting the lens cover open. Assuming you remember to double-check the function ring first OVERALL - Very disappointing - Buy something else
customer_reviews.author: -jdh

customer_reviews.title: MY FAVORITE CAMERA
customer_reviews.text: If you're not looking for an 'expert camera', but want something that's easy to use, good quality, and just a really good camera overall - this camera is for you. The touchscreen makes picking the focus a lot easier and looking through pictures similar to looking on your smart phone (but with better quality). You can also transfer photos without even using a cord, which I thought was really neat. I took this camera with me to Italy when I went and it was wonderful. I'm sad that I misplaced it in my various moves. This camera doesn't compare to the other PowerShots in this line.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie Lee

customer_reviews.title: Served it's Purpose
customer_reviews.text: Bought this camera to take pictures of our band's music gigs. It lasted over 6 years and was reliable eventhough at times I didn't really take care of it like I should had done. The picture quality is of course better than the video quality. In fact, I never really used it for video because it was so poor. All in all it served it's purpose and the pictures were clear enough. Would buy again but truthfully my band mates and I just use cell phones to take pics because of the easier access.
customer_reviews.author: Lion Rose Music

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera! Prior Owner of s95
customer_reviews.text: This camera is a very nice improvement over the prior versions. I owned an s95 and really liked it but sold it planning to upgrade to the s100. Decided to wait and use an old Canon camera until this came out. I love the touch screen. Very nice for tapping to focus on a particular area or face as well as for playback of pics. You can zoom easily and flick to view the saved pictures. The wifi feature is really nice for transfering the photos to your phone or just browsing the photos that are located on the camera on your phone and deciding which ones to bring over. Nice addition Canon! Very sharp photos!
customer_reviews.author: sa

customer_reviews.title: Would be perfect if wifi function and gps worked better
customer_reviews.text: This is such a great camera. It performs awesome, gives me all of the manual and raw functions i want and need that fits in my pocket. Two gripes only. Unfortunately the built in WiFi functionality only works with Canon apps or direct to social networks via Canon's image sharing service. Likewise with the GPS. If you dont carry around your smartphone and do GPS logging with the Canon app on your smartphone, the GPS function is almost useless. I hold out hope that future improvements will make the WiFi better, but for picture quality and battery life, I'm a happy camper.
customer_reviews.author: Chris D

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera
customer_reviews.text: bought this because my phone camera no longer focuses. More than that, I find the phone camera cumbersome and slow to use. This is small and can be difficult to hold while shooting, but I keep it in my pocket, I wanted small. This camera offers 100% control of settings, and optical stabilization. PSAM and even custom settings can be saved. A dial around the lens that can be assigned manual focus, zoom, ISO and more. Great pictures, 12mg sensor (plenty for a 1/1.7 chip) . Just what I wanted. No need to replace my phone! TIP: turn it on/off with the 'play' button, not power. Get a LowePro D-Wrap.
customer_reviews.author: DFB

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera -- Broke on Me
customer_reviews.text: Great camera! I loved it! I could achieve such great quality in such a small form factor. There was only one problem. I turned it on one day to notice that the lens would not open. Nothing more, nothing less. Just wouldn't open. Was very disappointed. I could not open this camera or use it. After that, the warranty process was EXTREMELY complicated and didn't want to get into that. We are in a love-hate relationship.
customer_reviews.author: Oliver Leopold

customer_reviews.title: Quality + Performance
customer_reviews.text: A very solid camera with a high quality lense that performs very well. I went with this model over some of the newer models based on reviews and could not be happier. Put a 64 gb card in and although it doesn't support cards over 32 gb, it works fine. The only issue with the card is that you don't know exactly how many photos you have remaining because it's >9999. I'm assuming when you get down to about 32 gb, it will start registering. I just wanted to maximize the HD video capacity with our new baby. Video quality is excellent and colors are rich. A very happy customer so far.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan E.

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic pocket camera that has professional features and shoots in RAW format
customer_reviews.text: I'm a pro Canon photographer. I always travel on business and don't have room for my larger camera, so I love to take a pocket camera with me. My Lumix finally gave up the ghost, so I started shopping around. I found the S110 and was thrilled at all the options and the fact that it shoots in RAW format so that I can bring the photos into Lightroom for adjustment. The flash tends to over expose the subjects, but it was easily adjustable by taking the flash compensation down a notch. Beautiful, true colors. Folks are amazed at how good a camera it is for a pocket. Love Canon products.
customer_reviews.author: Rob Alfieri

customer_reviews.title: Just okay.
customer_reviews.text: This is an ok camera. Pictures are pretty good quality, but video shows up shaky and you can constantly hear the clicking of the auto focus no matter what setting it is on. This is the perfect size to put in your pocket or bag. I would recommend this for pictures only. Battery life seems average. Seems to be very durable as my toddlers have not broken it yet. Not good for vlogging.
customer_reviews.author: Paige

customer_reviews.title: Great pictures ... very compact
customer_reviews.text: Really glad I researched and got this model. It has more features than I need but starting to have fun using things like miniature mode recording at 10x speed. Mostly though you get sharp pictures in a truly pocket size camera. It turns on pretty quickly even though the on button is kinda small...you easily get used to that. Reviewing your pictures is great using the touch screen. I got Wasabi spare batteries & charger set too. Haven't used the WiFi feature yet. The memory card is really easy to remove and download in a laptop.
customer_reviews.author: Fuzzlip

customer_reviews.title: and it has worked wonderfully for me
customer_reviews.text: I got a refurbished model, and it has worked wonderfully for me! Given the price, and what I'm getting out of it. I'm going to give it 5 starts. Pro: audio isn't as good as it could be, but for a point and shoot camera it's pretty good video is solid battery life generally lasts me all day unless in a super hot/humid environment turns on in a second and off just as quickly Con: wrist strap doesn't have a snap to secure it on your wrist, you can buy a cheap one if you need that image stabilizer isn't the best
customer_reviews.author: Katie O

customer_reviews.title: ... when I went to Hawaii and it was fairly good quality for what I paid for
customer_reviews.text: Used it when I went to Hawaii and it was fairly good quality for what I paid for! If you are looking for a beginning vlogging camera, I suggest this one. It's affordable and still good quality videos.
customer_reviews.author: Ani

customer_reviews.title: Such a good camera, we bought a 2nd one!
customer_reviews.text: I bought a white version of this camera and loved it so much that I bought a black version of it for my boyfriend. This one, oddly enough, has a less sensitive on/off button than our original white one. But if you press the button full-on it's not a problem. Also, the battery charger is tricky. It turns from red to green after 1 hour when the battery is NOT actually charged. We made the mistake of thinking the camera was not functioning properly because we hadn't fully charged the battery. It took 4 hours of the green light being on before it was truly charged. The rest works really great!
customer_reviews.author: Marilyse Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: So far it's real nice. It feels pretty solidly made
customer_reviews.text: So far it's real nice. It feels pretty solidly made, not like some cheap plastic cameras and it's easy to operate. I didn't even use the manual and I understand it just fine, but then again I've used similar cameras. It fits in my front jean pocket, even while riding my motorcycle and I hardly know it's there, it's that thin. Haven't had it long but so far it takes great pictures and video. I'm still thinking of ways to use it like a GoPro while riding my Motorcycle so I can upload video to you tube.
customer_reviews.author: Kirk B.

customer_reviews.title: What a great little P&S!
customer_reviews.text: I am anti point and shoot camera, but I had seen some amazing work done with one of these, and decided to check it out myself. I was still unsure about it when I finally purchased it- and was quickly impressed. I love all the options, being able to manually change settings, the video quality is amazing... and the slow motion video has brought tons of laughter into our home! I purchased the underwater housing for this, and have done some testing with it, and been VERY impressed! This little guy has changed my views on P&S cameras!
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Guy

customer_reviews.title: Absolutly best bang for buck point and shoot!
customer_reviews.text: I have the Sony RX100 II now which is what I replaced this with, I gave my old S110 to my aunt and bought a new one for my parents. Both parties equally technologically challenged, both parties now sending great quality pictures. this camera is my absolute fav worth every penny very highly recommended.! It's not as good as the Sony Rx100, but it's more pocket able, lighter and is much better value for money. The 2nd best packet point and shoot yuo can buy I would say!
customer_reviews.author: Dammika J

customer_reviews.title: Love the camera
customer_reviews.text: Love the camera. I had the predisesor version and used it for years. There are a lot of cool features on this camera like the touch screen, wifi uploads, picture with recording. The only thing that you need to get use to with this model is the hidden flash. If someone else is taking a picture 99% of the time their finger will be on the pop up area and you need to turn the camera off then on to make it work again.
customer_reviews.author: C. Costales

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding pocket camera
customer_reviews.text: I have owned this camera for about 8 months and 2000 pictures. It still works flawlessly and I love the Canon Android app that lets me transfer pictures to my phone with the S110's wi-fi. I can't say that the picture quality matches my wife's Canon DSLR, but I have taken many more 'keepers' with this camera since it's so much easier to bring along while traveling. I added a protective film to the LCD screen and the touch controls still work great.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Bought as a gift- my nephew loves it
customer_reviews.text: I did some research, op[tics seem good and this camera has one of the larger sensors among pocket-able cameras (so relatively large photo sites which means less low light noise) And it can save photos in raw, so you can do the whole grey card thing and get perfect white balance for wherever you're shooting. Thinking of getting one myself
customer_reviews.author: Bob KoureTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: DSLR Features in a point and shoot
customer_reviews.text: I previously had the Canon s100, although this camera is not drastically different than the prior model, it did make several improvements, such as wifi. I normally shoot with a Canon SL1, however, occasionally need something smaller that I can put in my pocket. This little camera has most of the same features, fully adjustable from ISO to aperture. It handles low light conditions great and has a lightening fast focus. Great point and shoot!
customer_reviews.author: MClancy

customer_reviews.title: Little great camera
customer_reviews.text: This camera is much better than other compact cameras. Its sensor is bigger than similar models: 1/1.7" (7.44 x 5.58 mm). The normal sensor has 1/2.3" (6.17 x 4.55 mm). It provides a better photo comparing to other cameras. Only Canon S110, Canon S120, and Nikon P340 have this type of sensors. Canon G16, Canon G15 and Nikon P7800 have it too, but they are bigger than others. For men, it is very easy to put it inside the front pocket of the pants. I recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Claudio

customer_reviews.title: Lens error - stay away
customer_reviews.text: Lens error - which is common to Canon cameras. Canon had put out a range of serial numbers for cameras with this error and would repair those for 'free'. The camera I purchased was outside of this range, and still encountered the same error. Apparently the error happens on high humidity days, or if a tiny particle (such as sand) gets lodged within the lens mechanism. For a camera this pricey, I figured they would fix it, but looks like they haven't. Not buying any Canon camera after this.
customer_reviews.author: SP

customer_reviews.title: Love the Canon S110
customer_reviews.text: I love this compact Canon S110. I have the white camera, which is cute and beautiful. The images are clear and sharp. I love the touch screen. For the Wi-Fi, I can connect this camera to my smartphone to view the photos from my camera on my smartphone, I can send my photos directly from this camera to Canon Image Gateway, Facebook, Twitter, Youtube, and other person emails. But I cannot send send my photos from this camera to my computer and printer wirelessly. To setup the Wi-Fi, I watched the video from youtube. Reading the manual on the CD is hard to understand on how to setup the Wi-Fi.
customer_reviews.author: Cutie

customer_reviews.title: but the pictures it takes are better looking (to me) than the Panasonic DMC-ZS6 it replaces
customer_reviews.text: I'm no pro, nor even a hobbyist, but the pictures it takes are better looking (to me) than the Panasonic DMC-ZS6 it replaces. I leave it in auto, the only setting I change is turning the flash on or off (usually just leaving it off). About 1/2 the time I turn on the flash, my finger is over it and prevents it from opening it correctly which causes the camera to turn itself off. Not sure what to do with the ring around the lens. I have it setup for stepped zoom, but I haven't used it much.
customer_reviews.author: Christian

customer_reviews.title: Screaming good deal!
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice, good quality point and shoot camera for everyday carry. I have owned earlier versions and have passed them on to family members wanting more than iphone quality photos. At a little more than 200, this is a very good camera for the money. It will require you to spend some time learning the capabilities if you want to use it to its full potential. Read the instructions and don't beat it up too much and your time and money will be well spent.
customer_reviews.author: Ellsworth Toohey

customer_reviews.title: Good picture and build quality
customer_reviews.text: This camera has a good picture, solid build quality, a reasonable intuitive design and button layout, and battery life is better than expected. However, low light performance is not as good as I hoped for the price. Video is also pretty bad. Popup flash is cool though. Overall I'd highly recommend this if you need something compact. If you're serious about photography while this does not have the same flexibilty and large sensor as a DSLR however it does carry most of the software options for it in manual mode.
customer_reviews.author: shovenose

customer_reviews.title: WOW!
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera!!! It is so easy to use and takes fantastic pictures and videos. I love the amount of zoom you get for such a small camera. My son graduated from basic training and then airborne school (was my reason for a new camera). I was able to take the camera with me both times. I now have awesome pictures and was not weighted down by carrying a heavy camera around. It's very user friendly and if you ever owned a similar camera you can almost figure out how to use it on your own.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie C.

customer_reviews.title: A very capable compact that doubles as a great camera to grow up with
customer_reviews.text: A fantastic camera, especially for the price. Bought as a birthday present for a 9 year old boy who likes to take photographs. He has a long way of growing up with this camera. It has many advanced features (wifi, touch screen) which help both on the ease of use front and when he grows up. The camera build is great and the controls are fantastic for a compact camera. I can even get him to shoot RAW when time comes, not to mention teach him about semi and full manual modes.
customer_reviews.author: Amnon G

customer_reviews.title: Great camera for the price.
customer_reviews.text: By far one of my favorite point and shoot cameras. Not only is this camera great for pictures but i mainly use it for video. Great image stabilization plus great in low light. You cannot beat the features and quality of this camera for its price. Great deal.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen L.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a Family
customer_reviews.text: We had a Nikon D40 for years and it took awesome pictures - of our kids, dog, vacations, etc. When it bit the dust after being dropped onto our driveway, I searched for something easier to transport on day trips or vacations. This fit the bill. We are not expert photographers, but enjoy good pictures to share with family, friends, etc. It's small and light, but still takes remarkable pictures. Perfect for a family on the go.
customer_reviews.author: KRuss

customer_reviews.title: Loved this camera and the pictures that it took
customer_reviews.text: Loved this camera and the pictures that it took. It is definitely a high tech camera with lots of functions. If you are not a techy, there are a lot of features that you may not even use. We did have this camera for one week, accidentally dropped it and the lens would no longer come out. We did purchase the warranty, and they could not fix it so we did get a full refund. Good thing we did purchase the warranty.
customer_reviews.author: rach

customer_reviews.title: Solid camera
customer_reviews.text: Great camera. We use it for vlogs. Sometimes the auto focus doesnt work well. Great for causal use. Built well. We've dropped this camera several times and it's still holding up well after 3 years of use.
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: Good picture quality for the price
customer_reviews.text: Good picture quality for the price. bought it last minute for a trip overseas. all the photos came out great. camera was light and easy to carry with decent battery life. If you plan on taking lots of pictures a second battery would be a good idea.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: Another quality product from Canon...
customer_reviews.text: Was looking for a quality camera for my wife and this fit the bill nicely. Camera is easy to learn, use and takes awesome photos! Love how small this camera is, and it's very study, feels good in your hands. Recommend adding a leather case designed for this model, just to protect it from drops or spills. Wife loves it!
customer_reviews.author: slidersrus

customer_reviews.title: No Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: When something goes wrong with a product, is when Customer Service has a chance to shine. Unfortunately in this case, this is not happening. The camera failed on a trip to Germany, and it shows "Camera Lens Problem". I have asked what I need to do to get it repaired, since the 30 days is past, but I have had no response. I guess there are things that you are definitely better off to buy locally. Lesson Learned!!!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Seems to have good picture quality
customer_reviews.text: Seems to have good picture quality. I started getting "Communication Error" when connecting to my computer, which seems to happen after you get 1000 images on the SD card. This stops you from connecting to the computer with the data cable and you will need to transfer images by taking out the SD card. This happened at around 32 GB for me, so you will need to remove images periodically if using a larger capacity memory card.
customer_reviews.author: H. A.

customer_reviews.title: Great camera but it has one annoying feature.
customer_reviews.text: Nice camera, very happy with it except the mic is extremely sensitive. If you shoot videos outside, you need a separate Mic source otherwise your video will sound like you were shooting during a tornado with even the lightest unnoticeable breeze imaginable.
customer_reviews.author: DR

customer_reviews.title: Impressive Camera
customer_reviews.text: Well built, easy to use, high iso, with many features. Although I have only had it for a few days, and have not tried all of it's features, I am very impressed. I am not an expert, but in my opinion, low light photography appears to be excellent when adjusted using manual mode. I expect to get some excellent snapshots of the night sky. Fantastic for a point and shoot camera.
customer_reviews.author: JCJ

customer_reviews.title: What a gem!
customer_reviews.text: This replaced an elph500HS that was stolen. I love this camera - both the creative flexibility it allows and the power of its auto modes. Unlike the elph500, access to the shutter and aperture priority modes is easy, as is bracketing. The high-dynamic range feature is great - despite what the manual says it can actually be used without a tripod (if you have a steady hand). Yea, battery life isn't that great (the elph500 had a bigger battery, why did they skimp on this model?)
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Siri Jodha S. Khalsa

customer_reviews.title: Nice size, good photos
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a small point-and-shoot that took better quality photos than my lower-end point and shoot, and was quickly ready for new photos. This has a large sensor, and does the trick. Very good size--not too big to put in your pocket, but not so small it is awkward to use. Only drawback--if it is that--is that it has a lot of features to choose from if you stray from automatic settings. You don't have to learn them, but they are there if you want higher levels of control, etc. Remarkable how much is in a small package.
customer_reviews.author: Roy E. Lachman

customer_reviews.title: Best choice for carry-everywhere camera for the serious photographer!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent carry everywhere camera. Small enough to fit in and be operated by one hand, but with features and picture qualities that would satisfy serious photography: RAW file format, 1:1 (square!) aspect ratio, F/2 zoom lens goes as wide as 24mm, etc. just to name a few. Mine also came in new condition. Will never need to rely on my cellphone for those unexpected picture possibilities!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just love this camera! Bright lens (f.2.0) makes the difference when comparing to other cameras.
customer_reviews.text: I was a very happy owner of a Canon S90 for more than four years and had no plans to replace it, because it is a very well constructed camera, make very nice pictures (bright lens, f.2.0) and never had any problem. But after being robbed, this was my obvious choice, and I have no regrets. The only thing that disappointed me was the WiFi feature (not really easy/practical to use). Also, Canon did not provide the MiniHDMI to HDMI cable as part of the package contents, and changed the model of the battery/changer (almost the same size as previous models, but not compatible; not sure if the specifications improved in this model).
customer_reviews.author: E. Nakahara

customer_reviews.title: Great photos at an attract price and small size
customer_reviews.text: Nice package in a small footprint (fits in my pant pocket while running around in tourist traps). Bought it at a great discount (after later models were introduced, but honestly I don't need the latest gadgetry). Takes videos in high definition. Battery life is so-so (esp. after some video shots). Good controls. Will buy again when I need to upgrade to the next model (I'm a loyal user of PowerShot cameras).
customer_reviews.author: J. Mistle

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. Picture quality for anything that doesn't move is top notch. I use it all the time, including some pictures that I've printed. It supplements my Nikon DSLR system when I need something small and quick with decent quality. If I were to nit-pic, it would be about how hard and confusing it is to wireless connect it. I gave up, but didn't buy it to do wireless, so I'm not dinging it.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Floaty.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Camera
customer_reviews.text: Great little camera we took it to Hawaii and the pictures came out so nice. No problem with the use or how to figure out how to use it. Everything was right at my fingertips. The picture and video were fantastic. Just had one issue trying to find the backlight feature. Not sure if it even has it. But it worked great for what I needed it for.
customer_reviews.author: D. Wnukowski

customer_reviews.title: Performs as Expected
customer_reviews.text: Takes great pictures; compact; easy to use . . . totally pleased. I can tuck it in a pocket or my purse and be assured of having a good picture of the unexpected sight or event. I do not carry a cell phone, certainly not a smart phone, so this is a good fit for my lifestyle.
customer_reviews.author: Roda46

customer_reviews.title: No more need for my Canon SLR
customer_reviews.text: A few weeks before taking a trip overseas my other Canon PowerShot was dropped and you could hear a sound in the camera although it continued to take great pictures. Not wanting to take the risk with a faulty lens I purchased this camera knowing I would be taking pictures in low light situations where the built-in flash wouldn't help the exposure. This camera was able to handle everything with little to no manipulation from the auto setting (turn off the flash and let the fast lens do it's job). Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: S. Bagley

customer_reviews.title: Really impressed with this camera.
customer_reviews.text: I just received and am getting acquainted but so far so good. It takes amazing pictures in the night time. I really like how it's a literally point and shoot camera. I can't be bothered with changing settings for each picture I want to take. I just want to take a picture and this camera has met those needs for me. I would recommend this camera to others. Oh and yes it does take getting used to the location of the flash but it's not a killer for me.
customer_reviews.author: asher

customer_reviews.title: Great low light performance
customer_reviews.text: I replaced my S100 with this camera. It has a fast lens and over sized sensor, so low light performance is very good. This model has a touch screen, higher ISO setting and some ergonomic improvements over the S100 (easier manual focusing for example). One minor complaint - the LCD screen has a slight greenish cast to it.
customer_reviews.author: tom

customer_reviews.title: When the lighting is good, it takes great pictures
customer_reviews.text: Every serious photographer needs a pocket camera, when it isn't appropriate to carry a professional model. The Canon S110 can capture images in raw mode, suitable for import into PhotoShop or Lightroom. When the lighting is good, it takes great pictures.
customer_reviews.author: Peter McKone

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this camera for my girlfriend whom is an aspiring photographer. Unfortunately the first camera had dead pixels/black lines on the screen. Amazon was quick to ship out a new one that has since been flawless. I normally don't write reviews I just wanted to point out that Amazon did a great job of taking care of me here. I considered buying one of these for my self for the days I don't wish to carry around my Canon 5D.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Wyant

customer_reviews.title: All the functions of big camera in a convenient size
customer_reviews.text: So far so good! Love the large screen and it's a touch screen! I shot photos all over Europe for a month. The camera is very user-friendly and I love all the functionalities - I haven't even used them all yet. I need to sit down and read the manual since there have been a lot of upgrades since my last PowerShot camera. Good thing with Canon's is that they are very consistent so you can almost always figure out how touse it without the manual.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny T.

customer_reviews.title: Best point and shoot you can buy
customer_reviews.text: Best point and shoot you can buy. Battery life is not superb, but the camera is very compact, so the battery is tiny. Good news is generic extra battery is cheap and works fine. Satisfied with video quality so far. Very versatile user settings and presets. Great in low light. I really like the WiFi to wireless device and computer function. I have an ancient iPhone 3 and it is compatible with the wireless upload feature.
customer_reviews.author: Franklestein

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased with limited use so far!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera mostly to use for low light photography at concerts and horse shows. I didn't want to spend a lot since it would be for casual pics for my own use. I've only used it at 2 concerts so far and the pictures came out great! It was very easy to get used to the settings and controls, but the auto setting did everything that I needed. I just turned off the flash for most of the pictures and they came out really good ....even with different color concert lighting! My purchase of this camera was based on the specs and features of the G16 camera that a friend uses.
customer_reviews.author: Cris S

customer_reviews.title: Great photos. Why 2 stars
customer_reviews.text: Great photos. Why 2 stars? I've had TWO of these have the same issue: the flash stops firing. I think it's a loose or damaged ribbon cable. And before you think I have a setting incorrect: I teach digital photography and electronic repair. Believe me, I've tried all fixes which don't involve opening it up, since cameras are a nightmare to fix.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just a normal decent compact camera from Canon
customer_reviews.text: Had to return as the quality of the buttons and touch screen wasn't as smooth as I read on reviews. Picture quality was nothing amazing or better than my cellphone. On a positive note, this is a small compact decent handheld if you don't want to use a cellphone.
customer_reviews.author: NewYorker

customer_reviews.title: wide angle shots
customer_reviews.text: I bought this about a year ago. It's not rugged but it's perfect for travelling as its wide angle shots really capture the scenery. It fell once, and the lens mechanism got broken immediately. But fortunately it was still covered by Canon warranty so they fixed it for free.
customer_reviews.author: kaye

customer_reviews.title: Impressive camera . . .
customer_reviews.text: I continue to be impressed with the Canon S110 -- both picture quality and features. This camera has many useful features packed into a small package, more flexibility than most people will need. It is my take-everywhere camera and I rarely encounter a situation where it is not up to the job at hand. In my opinion, it is the current king of the compact digital cameras.
customer_reviews.author: The Rabbi

customer_reviews.title: Good little camera
customer_reviews.text: Good little camera. Works as directed. The battery life is painfully short in video mode. But it’s a good camera to start with if you’re doing vlogging or youtube vids. Software is acceptable, but they really need to upgrade to download links rather than a CD, which is cumbersome and needless in this day and age.
customer_reviews.author: AlexSuperFire

customer_reviews.title: Compact Camera
customer_reviews.text: Good quality images for the amateur photographer. I use this while traveling since it's small, and it's a nice white (off white) color. I've used Canon PowerShot cameras before and I'm happy with this one.
customer_reviews.author: BPSA

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic camera, super images as determined by me, a picky experienced photo hobbyist and retired photography teacher.
customer_reviews.author: DPH

customer_reviews.title: Best choice so far
customer_reviews.text: Tho was a birthday gift for my sister. Best choice so far.. She fell in love with it. I'm not much of a camera techie, but I must admit I have yet to see better quality pictures than those caught with it. Video performance is great, too, and quite affordable. I'm happy I could please my sis with this. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Rochelle w

customer_reviews.title: best buy in town
customer_reviews.text: best buy in town. bad battery life as they say. if it had a viewfinder like the better ones and a better battery life, i'd be in love. pictures so far are excellent. exposures great. manual could be a lot better. small cameras are a pain to control and set the way you want them. this one is no exception. she's a really good little compact. just the right size for your back up. cute too. missing is the thumb grip from the S100. really dumb change.
customer_reviews.author: peter hiltner

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera & good size for carrying around
customer_reviews.text: Best little camera I ever owned. I have had at least 3 small cameras from other vendors & this was the best. It is nice that it has a touch screen & is WiFi.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Wow, wotta camera!
customer_reviews.text: Compact, fits comfortably Case Logic(ed) in the front pocket of my jeans! Tested in Bhutan last week, it does well! Low light was a problem with my 5 year old Canon Elph, the S110 takes some spectacular pictures even in low light. The camera is easy to use, controls feel good, not too comfortable with the wi-fi seems overly complicated to set up, I'm not doing it anytime soon.
customer_reviews.author: Raincoconuts

customer_reviews.title: Good camera. Holds its value very well
customer_reviews.text: Good camera. Holds its value very well. Used cameras now selling for more than when I bought it new, for good reason.
customer_reviews.author: Lambert

customer_reviews.title: Minor (but good) upgrade from the s100
customer_reviews.text: We picked this up to replace a broken S100 (dropped it and broke the lens). It's a nice upgrade from the 100 with mainly the wireless being an added feature that seems to be useful after only a few weeks of use. It's a nice dependable camera.
customer_reviews.author: jluikart

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE this tiny camera
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this tiny camera. I'd been using my iPhone for pictures for quite a while, but usually had to enhance and sharpen them up. Now I just carry this in my pocket and it shoots perfect pictures all the time. Have it set on "P" instead of automatic to keep the flash from needlessly flashing...as it is an excellent low light camera.
customer_reviews.author: Phaira

customer_reviews.title: great little raw shooting camera
customer_reviews.text: I like shooting in raw. This little pocket camera gives the user so much control over shooting, it's a fantastic camera. I like the control, but battery life is short, you need an extra battery which is no problem; batteries are cheap. I give the camera a 5 star because it is a 5 star camera.
customer_reviews.author: Rmac

customer_reviews.title: Good shirt pocket camera.
customer_reviews.text: I bought it for my wife. I use it when I don't feel like logging my Nikon D600 with heavy Zeiss lenses. I would have loved it even more if it had an electronic view finder. The screen is barely visible when the sun is behind you. Otherwise it take well balanced pictures.
customer_reviews.author: Slamron

customer_reviews.title: Long exposure ISO limited to 80
customer_reviews.text: I ended up returning the item as it did not meet my night photography needs. Its limitations were more extreme than the s95 I was buying this to replace. If you're not into long exposure photos, then it's a fantastic camera though!
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Detail and color and great so far
customer_reviews.text: Haven't been able to test all the functions of this camera yet. Detail and color and great so far. Auto ISO tends to lean toward the darker side a lot of the time though.
customer_reviews.author: Jmoney

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera, do something about the strap
customer_reviews.text: This is a great, high quality camera. One tiny drawback is the strap that you hold it with. It is almost a challenge at my house to find anyone who can attach it. Still to date, no winners. The hole you are meant to stick it through has an impossible bend and I so I remain strapless.
customer_reviews.author: Terry S

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Camera
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful point and shoot camera. Makes excellent photographs. I am really impressed with the photos I made in low light situations. One of the two best cameras I have owned.
customer_reviews.author: CapCase

customer_reviews.title: Canon Powershot series is excellent
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality images. Tiny size fits in your pocket. Sturdy build. I've owned the S95 and will continue to purchase this line of cameras for it's quality
customer_reviews.author: ANH N.

customer_reviews.title: Nice camera for a decent price
customer_reviews.text: Nice camera for a decent price. However, I was eager about the wifi automatic uploading function. It is WAYYYY too complicated - I have never gotten it to work, and I am not tech illiterate.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Eric Morris

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera!
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera. I researched it for my dad (I am a professional photographer). I did have to return it because he said my mom wouldn't like the lens piece sticking out when the camera was off. I guess it sits out a bit which is hard to see in the photo.
customer_reviews.author: Momtographer

customer_reviews.title: one of the best travel cameras
customer_reviews.text: I took this camera with me on a one-month trip through Europe last summer. I used it in all kinds of situations and it performed excellent. I have received many complements on the night-time photography done with a tripod.
customer_reviews.author: Joe B.

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect camera for "aim and shoot" beginners like me. I love the 3 inch LCD screen and the quality of photos.
customer_reviews.author: Sedona

customer_reviews.title: Great pictures, easy wifi uploading
customer_reviews.text: Having owned the s90 and the s95, I knew to expect good things from this camera. It's the perfect compromise between portability and features. I have been especially impressed with the Macro focus shots I've been able to get. Low-light performance is also very good. I carry my white s110 in theand it looks very sharp. A word about wifi transfers: the speed at which photos and movies are uploaded to your computer depends on your home internet speed, not on the s110. Reviewers who experience slow uploads shouldn't blame the s110. I use the wifi option to upload photos to my laptop after a day of shooting and it's a very easy process.
customer_reviews.author: Marcus Censor

customer_reviews.title: RAW!
customer_reviews.text: This is a really good camera for the price. I think it's one of the least expensive to shoot RAW. You have to put it in manual mode to get that option, but in manual you can set everything back to auto.
customer_reviews.author: R. Collins

customer_reviews.title: My favorite vlogging camera
customer_reviews.text: The perfect vlogging camera! I bought this on a whim on a trip to Sundance and it worked perfectly. The sound is clear the image is SO sharp and the image is not too shaky. The focus sometimes shifts and takes a while to readjust but other than that this camera takes great pictures and videos.
customer_reviews.author: Maria Emilia

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. I've taken many hundreds of pictures on multiple vacations without a single issue. Each time, I would be repeatedly turning it on and off to take picture after picture. No shutter error, etc. Take great pics!
customer_reviews.author: Deez

customer_reviews.title: Excelent camera, but not perfect
customer_reviews.text: The camera itself is wonderful. Nice functions, lots of settings and there is a slow motion video very interesting. But I didn't like two things: 1) It is very difficult to not lock the flash when it goes up. The place where it is located is very close to the place where we naturally place our fingers. 2) The Wi-FI function is not very easy to use. It should be something more direct to connect to computers. Despite those two issues, it is a good choise!
customer_reviews.author: Hervandil M. S. Anna

customer_reviews.title: Amazing quality!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera to travel during the summer and I love it so far. The camera took clear photos with perfect lighting and it was lightweight too. I would have to say this camera is perfect for anyone who wants a camera for on-the-go.
customer_reviews.author: Dianna

customer_reviews.title: I love it
customer_reviews.text: I love everything about it except the Wi-Fi (I am not smart enough to figure out how to use it). I bought this camera to replace a S100 that died. It takes great photos. I would recommend it to friends.
customer_reviews.author: Jojob

customer_reviews.title: Perfect high quality compact camera
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic camera! It takes great pictures in low light and is the perfect camera for someone who wants a high quality compact camera instead of using cell phone. It fits right in your pocket and I plan on taking it hiking/backpacking primarily.
customer_reviews.author: ReturnOf7heKing

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't any happier
customer_reviews.text: So far the camera has done everything I could want of it. I am no photographer I just wanted something a little nicer then your average point and shoot and this worked out perfectly. I have even started to mess with manual setting and I am really impressed about everything it can do. It's ability to act as a wifi hotspot so you can link your phone/tablet to it and send pictures is actually really nice since they can't take the memory card like a computer. The video quality is excellent and the picture quality is better then I imagined. If you are an average person looking for something a little nicer grab this you wont be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: mhemling33

customer_reviews.title: Not so good low light - shutter cover fails
customer_reviews.text: I have always loved Canon point and shoots. In fact my best pictures have been with my original Canon S400 and/or my DSLR. I purchased the S110 as an upgrade and expected better shots. Outdoor photos in good lighting and also videos turn out great. However, the camera can't take decent low light pictures, hardly anything great indoors. BUT the worst thing is that literally 3 days after receiving this camera, the shutter cover on the outside of the lens failed to open. This is a huge defect. Three days?? Common.
customer_reviews.author: Jones

customer_reviews.title: Buy this camera if you feel like gambling.
customer_reviews.text: This camera seems to have a problem with locking focus, handheld or tripod, and as a consequence pictures come out out of focus. I have sent this camera to Canon twice, and it seems they are happy to sell you a refurbished product, than take care of the problem. It is a great camera if you want to play the lottery, but if you loose get ready to deal with a company that don't care to make things right.
customer_reviews.author: Efrain Vicente Figueroa

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera!
customer_reviews.text: Has a lot of manual adjustments but, takes great pictures in Auto as well. Low light pictures look great. My SLR will be used less now that we have a serious compact camera. It will not replace an SLR but, it's a great camera to have on you all the time. Transferring pictures to my phone is simple and allows me to share them instantly.
customer_reviews.author: Raul Amador

customer_reviews.title: Cant' go wrong!
customer_reviews.text: It a great camera! I bought it for my wife who just wants to shoot on auto. I have a Nikon D800 and a Canon G1X. But this goes in the pocket no sweat. Very impressed and for for under $200!!! Half the price of the S120.
customer_reviews.author: RBO

customer_reviews.title: it's a great continuation of the S series
customer_reviews.text: I came from an S90 and really wish that the thumb wheel could be assigned to exposure compensation instead of needing to use the D-pad or touch screen. Otherwise, it's a great continuation of the S series.
customer_reviews.author: trailmug

customer_reviews.title: I love this little camera!
customer_reviews.text: I am using this camera as a replacement for my broken DSLR. The picture quality is great for a camera at this price point. Even better is the video and playback quality. It performs decent in low light, even though it is not a particularly low light capable lens. Another benefit is the WiFi capability, making it easy to upload photos to your computer or wherever you want to store them.
customer_reviews.author: N. Master

customer_reviews.title: Great camera for bringing along everywhere.
customer_reviews.text: I love to take photos, but can't always bring along my DSLR. This camera takes surprisingly good photos, despite its small size and is fully adjustable. I usually buy Nikon, but this is one Canon I'm happy to carry.
customer_reviews.author: D. Roberts

customer_reviews.title: This is something for the people who like SLR features/quality but don't want to get into heavy ...
customer_reviews.text: This is something for the people who like SLR features/quality but don't want to get into heavy gears. Pricey but worth it! Some issues with settings and focuses slow when to tap on screen but that's something you can live with after you master all the settings. WiFi should have been better and faster. Touch is awesome.
customer_reviews.author: MPHS

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with the product
customer_reviews.text: Does everything I need in a quick pocket camera, no problems to report here would consider purchasing again shoots excellent photos and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: groundfighter

customer_reviews.title: outdated
customer_reviews.text: It was na nice camera but broke after a year.
customer_reviews.author: Consumer

product_meta.title: Canon PowerShot S110 12MP Digital Camera with 3-Inch LCD (Black)
product_meta.description:
Color:Black| Style:BaseThe PowerShot S110 packs a world of advancements like a 12.1 Megapixel High-Sensitivity CMOS sensor and DIGIC 5 Image Processor, 12-bit multi aspect RAW+JPEG, 24mm Wide-Angle, bright f/2.0 lens with 5x Optical Zoom into a sleek pocket-sized body. The camera also has built-in Wi-Fi that lets you share images and video online, exchange images with another Wi-Fi PowerShot camera, print from a Wi-Fi enabled printer, and wirelessly tag your images with GPS information recorded by a smartphone with the free Canon CameraWindow app. What's is in the Box: PowerShot S110 Digital Camera (black shown) Battery Pack NB-5L Battery Charger CB-2LX Wrist Strap WS-DC11 USB Interface Cable IFC-400PCU Digital Camera Solution CD

What's is in the Box: 


 * PowerShot S110 Digital Camera (black shown)
 * Battery Pack NB-5L
 * Battery Charger CB-2LX
 * Wrist Strap WS-DC11
 * USB Interface Cable IFC-400PCU
 * Digital Camera Solution CD



FROM THE MANUFACTURER
 Untitled Document 

SUPERB PERFORMANCE WITH A WIRELESS TOUCH
The PowerShot S110 packs a world of advancements into its sleek, pocket-sized body. While the camera makes it easy enough for any user to achieve beautiful image quality, it gives serious photographers the tools they need to take their creative expression to the highest level, including a 12.1 Megapixel High-Sensitivity CMOS sensor and DIGIC 5 Image Processor that create the exclusive Canon HS SYSTEM, and 12-bit multi aspect RAW+JPEG. The 24mm Wide-Angle, bright f/2.0 lens with 5x Optical Zoom and ISO speeds all the way up to 12800 deliver breathtaking images, even in low light. At the same time, this is an incredibly convenient camera, with new High Speed AF for sharply reduced lag time, a new capacitive touch panel LCD, and built-in Wi-Fi® that lets you share images and video online, exchange images with another Wi-Fi® PowerShot camera, print from a Wi-Fi® enabled printer^, and wirelessly tag your images with GPS# information recorded by a smartphone with the free Canon CameraWindow app*. Experience the take-anywhere, do-anything PowerShot S110.

^ DPS over IP certified printer is required.
# In certain countries and regions, the use of GPS may be restricted. Therefore be sure to use GPS in accordance with the laws and regulations of your country or region. Be particularly careful when traveling outside your home country. As a signal is received from GPS satellites, take sufficient measures when using in locations where the use of electronics is regulated. Cellular data charges may apply.
* This software enables you to upload images to social network services. Before uploading images, please be aware that image files may contain privacy related information such as people and places. If necessary, please delete such information. Canon does not obtain, collect or use such images or any information included in such images through this software.

SHARE IMAGES AND VIDEO WHEREVER YOU ARE
BUILT-IN WI-FI® ALLOWS YOU TO WIRELESSLY TRANSFER YOUR IMAGES TO SOCIAL NETWORKING SITES THROUGH CANON IMAGE GATEWAY#; TO A PC OR UPLOAD VIRTUALLY ANYWHERE ON YOUR IOS OR ANDROID DEVICE* WITH THE FREE DOWNLOAD OF THE CANON CAMERAWINDOW APP**, SHARE IMAGES BETWEEN WI-FI® ENABLED POWERSHOT CAMERAS AND EVEN PRINT YOUR IMAGES ON A WI-FI® COMPATIBLE PRINTER^.
The PowerShot S110 is equipped with built-in Wi-Fi® for on-the-go convenience when you want to share what you've recorded with friends, family and the whole world. The camera makes it easy to connect directly to both iOS and Android devices*, and upload images via the free Canon CameraWindow app**. Using CANON iMAGE GATEWAY#, you can easily post your images to your favorite social networking sites to update friends and family while you're traveling or just out and about. Even without a mobile device, you can send images to a PC, share images between Wi-Fi® enabled PowerShot cameras and you can even print in a snap by sending your images wirelessly to a Wi-Fi® compatible printer^.

# One-time registration is required on CANON iMAGE GATEWAY.
* Compatible with iOS version 4.3 or later and Android devices version 1.1.1.11 or later. Data charges may apply.
** This software enables you to upload images to social network services. Before uploading images, please be aware that image files may contain privacy related information such as people and places. If necessary, please delete such information. Canon does not obtain, collect or use such images or any information included in such images through this software.
^ DPS over IP certified printer is required.

A BRIGHT AND POWERFUL NEW LENS
5X OPTICAL ZOOM WITH 24MM WIDE-ANGLE LENS ALLOWS YOU TO CAPTURE MORE IN YOUR FRAME, AND A BRIGHT F/2.0 LENS MAKES IT IDEAL FOR LOW-LIGHT CONDITIONS OR USING SHALLOW DEPTH-OF-FIELD FOR DRAMATIC, SOFT BACKGROUNDS.
Newly engineered specifically for the PowerShot S110, the camera's 24mm Wide-Angle 5x Optical Zoom lens with a focal length of 5.2–26.0mm (35mm film equivalent: 24–120mm) achieves f/2.0–f/5.9, giving the user exceptional versatility. The Wide-Angle lens gives your images a distinctive sweep and grandeur, capturing landscapes, cityscapes, tall buildings and wide groups of people with ease. The large f/2.0 aperture allows you to achieve shallow depth-of-field for creating portraits with beautiful, soft background blur, and incomparable Canon optical technology delivers a high performance lens enabling incredible images, even in low light.

BEAUTIFUL IMAGES AND FAST PERFORMANCE START HERE
12.1 MEGAPIXEL HIGH-SENSITIVITY CMOS SENSOR
The PowerShot S110 employs a Canon 12.1 Megapixel CMOS sensor, which delivers state-of-the-art imaging performance and is optimized for use in compact cameras. Utilizing a sophisticated light-capturing design, it provides high sensitivity for improved high ISO capture with reduced noise. It is also a high-speed design, capable of rapidly capturing and moving image data to the processor, enabling faster continuous shooting and faster autofocus.

CANON DIGIC 5 IMAGE PROCESSOR
The latest-generation Canon DIGIC 5 Image Processor works with the PowerShot S110's image sensor to bring phenomenal increases in processing speed and power, delivering incredible detail in more situations, without the need for artificial light sources. Improved noise reduction produces clearer images when shooting in low light at high ISO speeds. The faster processing speed results in faster continuous shooting capability while maintaining full image quality. With the power of the DIGIC 5 Image Processor, the PowerShot S110 can achieve higher ISO sensitivity and even perform advanced functions like lens correction, special scene modes and much more.

CANON HS SYSTEM FOR EXCEPTIONAL LOW-LIGHT PERFORMANCE UP TO ISO 12800
The PowerShot S110 gives you the power to create images with spectacular depth, detail and emotional resonance. The 12.1 Megapixel High-Sensitivity CMOS sensor works in concert with Canon's own latest-generation DIGIC 5 Image Processor to create the renowned Canon HS SYSTEM. With the Canon HS SYSTEM, you'll experience excellent tracking performance even in low light, and achieve gorgeous still image quality even at high ISO speeds all the way up to ISO 12800; beautiful low-light shots are possible with minimal noise and maximum detail in highlight and shadow areas. The Canon HS SYSTEM lets you use higher shutter speeds to capture clearer images with reduced noise and blur in a variety of situations for incredible photos and even when shooting video.

GET THE COMPLETE HD EXPERIENCE
CAPTURE STUNNING 1080P FULL HD VIDEO IN STEREO SOUND WITH A DEDICATED MOVIE BUTTON; VIDEO FUNCTIONS INCLUDE FINE DETAIL MOVIE PROCESSING FOR LIFELIKE IMAGES, ZOOM WHILE SHOOTING, AND CONVENIENT PLAYBACK ON AN HDTV VIA THE HDMI OUTPUT.
Simply touch the dedicated movie button, now conveniently embedded in the PowerShot S110's thumb pad, to start recording video in 1080p Full HD. Video captured in 1080p Full HD is breathtakingly vivid and realistic, and Canon's Fine Detail Movie Processing achieves beautiful videos with high resolution processing that records approximately 4x the amount of information during video shooting for even greater image clarity and sharp portrayal of even the most delicate of details. You're free to use the full range of the zoom in movie mode, and sound is recorded in stereo. An HDMI output allows you to view and share your video on an HDTV immediately, simply by connecting the camera to the TV with an optional HDMI cable.


ENHANCED TOUCH PANEL CAPABILITIES
A 3.0-INCH CAPACITIVE TOUCH PANEL PURECOLOR SYSTEM LCD OFFERS EASY AND INTUITIVE OPERATION, AND TOUCH SHUTTER MAKES SHOOTING EASY AND INTERACTIVE.
Anyone familiar with today’s touch screens will feel comfortable using the PowerShot S110 right away. The big 3.0-inch PureColor System LCD responds to familiar one- and two-finger touch operations. Users can spread and pinch to change the magnification in playback, drag two fingers to switch display, use the easy interactive Touch Shutter, and quickly select camera settings. You can even adjust the panel’s touch sensitivity to your liking. The camera’s sophisticated control ring, located at the base of the lens barrel, can be used in conjunction with the Touch Panel to conveniently access a range of additional actions.


FASTER FOCUS AND HIGH-SPEED SHOOTING
HIGH SPEED AF GREATLY IMPROVES FOCUS SPEED AND HIGH-SPEED BURST HQ ALLOWS FOR CONTINUOUS CAPTURE AT A MAXIMUM OF 10 FRAMES*** WHILE MAINTAINING SUPERB IMAGE QUALITY.
The PowerShot S110 is equipped with Canon's latest advancement in AF technology: High Speed AF. The result of several improved technologies, High Speed AF delivers significantly faster focus speed of 0.2 seconds and a dramatically reduced shooting lag time of 0.25 seconds, for a super-responsive shooting experience that lets you capture every great shot as it happens. The technology also powers the camera's new High-Speed Burst HQ, with continuous capture at a maximum speed of approximately 10 fps. Moreover, images captured in High-Speed Burst HQ maintain the camera's superb image quality.

*** The continuous shooting speed is approximately 10.0 fps. 

OPTIMAL IMAGE STABILIZATION IN ANY SITUATION
INTELLIGENT IS AUTOMATICALLY CHOOSES FROM SIX DIFFERENT MODES TO OPTIMIZE IMAGE STABILIZATION FOR THE SHOOTING CONDITION.
It's easy to capture clear, steady images with the PowerShot S110, even in low light without using a tripod. That's because the camera is equipped with Canon's innovative Intelligent IS. The system analyzes camera movement and applies the best shake correction method for the shooting situation – allowing you to focus on framing and capturing your shot. For stills, the system automatically selects among Normal, Panning, Macro (Hybrid) and Tripod IS modes. When shooting video, the system automatically selects among Dynamic, Powered, Macro and Tripod IS modes.

Normal Corrects for a wide range of camera movement when shooting stills. Panning Panning motion is detected so that IS does not interfere with desired camera movement. Macro (Hybrid) Corrects for shift-type camera shake, which typically occurs in macro (close-up) shooting. Dynamic Effective for video shooting at wide-angle focal lengths, eliminating the unwanted shaking that typically occurs while walking. Powered Compensates for hand movement when shooting video at the telephoto end of the zoom range, where camera shake is magnified. Tripod When tripod use is detected, the Image Stabilizer is stopped because it is not needed. SET YOUR CREATIVITY FREE
FULL RANGE OF SHOOTING AND RECORDING MODES INCLUDING 12-BIT MULTI ASPECT RAW+JPEG, AS FOUND IN CANON DSLR CAMERAS, FOR THE ULTIMATE CREATIVE CONTROL.
As with many EOS DSLR cameras, the PowerShot S110 uses a 12-bit converter to process the output of the CMOS sensor, resulting in true color, smooth tonal transitions and natural gradations. The PowerShot S110 lets you shoot in RAW mode, which records all the information captured by the sensor, giving you outstanding flexibility and complete creative control when editing your images with Canon’s powerful bundled software, and the camera allows you to record in RAW and JPEG formats simultaneously. Now in RAW mode, you can even select among several aspect ratios, including 16:9, 3:2, 4:3, 1:1, and 4:5.

ADD GPS DATA TO EASILY IDENTIFY IMAGES BY TIME AND LOCATION
RECORD GPS+ DATA ON YOUR SMARTPHONE USING THE FREE DOWNLOAD OF THE CANON CAMERAWINDOW APP** AND WIRELESSLY ADD THE LOCATION DATA TO THE IMAGES IN YOUR CAMERA.
The PowerShot S110 with its built-in Wi-Fi® allows you to tag images with GPS+ data recorded by your smartphone loaded with the free Canon CameraWindow app**. With an easy setup, your smartphone will record location data such as latitude, longitude, altitude and shooting time. Then after you're done shooting, simply transfer the location data to wirelessly add the information to the images in camera. Perfect for organizing albums and vacation photos, this feature ensures you'll always know where and when your images were recorded.

+ In certain countries and regions, the use of GPS may be restricted. Therefore be sure to use GPS in accordance with the laws and regulations of your country or region. Be particularly careful when traveling outside your home country. As a signal is received from GPS satellites, take sufficient measures when using in locations where the use of electronics is regulated. Cellular data charges may apply.
** This software enables you to upload images to social network services. Before uploading images, please be aware that image files may contain privacy related information such as people and places. If necessary, please delete such information. Canon does not obtain, collect or use such images or any information included in such images through this software.

ADDITIONAL FEATURES
CONTROL RING
Focus, aperture, shutter speed, ISO, step zoom, exposure compensation, aspect ratio, i-Contrast, or white balance can be adjusted more quickly and conveniently with the PowerShot S110's control ring. Located at the base of the lens barrel, the ring is more intuitive than other types of controls for many experienced photographers. The functions that can be assigned to the control ring vary with shooting mode, and you can set your preferences quickly using the dedicated ring function selector button.

SHOOTING MODES
PowerShot cameras offer shooting modes that make it easy to take perfect photos in a wide range of shooting situations by providing intelligent presets with optimized settings.


SHOOTING MODES/SPECIAL SCENE MODES
Custom Define and store your own settings to achieve the effects you prefer. Manual You have complete control of exposure, selecting both aperture and shutter speed manually. Aperture-Priority You set the aperture, controlling depth-of-field. The camera automatically selects the shutter speed. Shutter-priority You select the shutter speed to stop or blur action, and the camera finds the appropriate aperture. With slow exposure times, Canon's noise reduction system activates to ensure low image noise. Program Access advanced exposure compensation features while shooting mostly automatically. Smart AUTO The camera automatically selects the best shooting settings for optimal quality based on subjects and environmental factors to provide point-and-shoot simplicity. Movie Digest Records a video clip before capturing a still image and then combines one day’s worth of clips into a video. Now easily playback and review clips, and delete unwanted scenes. Portrait The camera sets a large aperture, focusing the subject and artistically blurring the background to make your subject “pop.” Smooth Skin Removes dullness, wrinkles, and harsh shadows for beautiful faces. Smart Shutter The camera automatically takes the photo when people smile, wink, or get into frame. High-Speed Burst HQ Captures fast-action shots at full sensor resolution, by shooting continuously when the shutter button is held down. Handheld Night Scene Take clear and steady pictures at night without the use of a tripod. Snow Shoot clear snow scenes without darkened subjects or an unnatural bluish tint. Fireworks Grab brilliant images of skyrocketing fireworks. Stitch Assist Easy-to-use guidelines simplify the shooting of aligned multiple frames that can later be combined (using bundled software) to create panoramic photos. Creative Filters This setting provides easy access to special filter effects and scene modes, such as Toy Camera Effect, Poster Effect, Monochrome and more. High Dynamic Range The camera combines three different exposures to get one evenly lit image. Nostalgic Create the look and feel of old photographs using sepia tones and black-and-white. Miniature Effect for Movies & Stills Emphasizes perspectives for a miniature effect by blurring upper and bottom portions of the image. Soft Focus Creates a hazy ambiance that’s perfect for portraits and wedding photos. Super Vivid Super Vivid intensifies existing hues, saturating the scene with bright colors. Color Accent Choose to retain a single color in your image while other colors turn monochrome. Color Swap Select a color and replace it with a color you specify for special effects. Movie Record video in stereo sound. Unwanted scenes can be deleted in playback mode. iFrame Movie The Apple® movie format, iFrame, makes it easier and quicker to import and upload videos while retaining high image quality. Super Slow Motion Movie Record your clips in high speed (approx. 240 fps), and then watch your videos in slow motion. DIRECT CONNECT TO YOUR PRINTER
It's quick and easy to make beautiful prints from your PowerShot camera with Canon's Direct Print system. Directly connect your PowerShot camera to a Canon PIXMA or SELPHY photo printer with a USB cable and simply press the button to print; turn every favorite moment into an amazing photo.

AVAILABLE IN 30 LANGUAGES
There are now a total of 30 display languages from which you can choose: English, German, French, Dutch, Danish, Finnish, Italian, Norwegian, Swedish, Spanish, Simplified/Traditional Chinese, Japanese, Russian, Portuguese, Korean, Greek, Polish, Czech, Hungarian, Turkish, Thai, Arabic, Romanian, Ukrainian, Farsi, Hindi, Malay, Indonesian and Vietnamese.
